column1: Title: State Data and Policy Actions to Address Coronavirus | The Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation

column2: Statewide (25); Affected Counties (1); High-risk Groups (4); No Action (21)
column3: All Travelers (8); All Air Travelers (1); From Certain States (3); No Action (39)
column4: All Non-Essential Businesses (27); All Non-Essential Retail Businesses (4); Other (4); No Action (16)
column5: All Gatherings Prohibited (16); >10 Prohibited (22); 50+ Prohibited (2); Other (5); No action (6)
column7: Closed except for takeout/delivery (44); Limited on-site service (4); Other (2); No action (1)

column1: For purposes of this table, states were included if they mandated the listed actions. A number of states released guidance or recommendations related to the actions listed in this table but fell short of issuing a requirement and are thus not included.
1. Governors in AL, IA, and VA have closed many, but not all, non-essential businesses.
2. While the CA governor has not officially mandated the statewide closure of schools, the state's mandatory quarantine order effectively closes all schools.
3. CT and RI have prohibited gatherings larger than five people, with limited exceptions.
4. Please see links in Sources tab for more details.
5. NE has enacted a large gatherings ban, school closures, and bar/restaurant limits in counties where community spread has been confirmed.
6. OK has mandated closure of all non-essential businesses and limited bar/restaurants to carry-out and delivery only in affected counties.
7. Gatherings also limited to 50% of venue capacity if such limitation would be under 50 people.
